Target Description ================== XO-2 is a star with a detected substellar companion, XO-2 b, and is a target of the Extrasolar Planet Observation and CHaracterization (EPOCh) phase of the NASA EPOXI mission. Other designations for this star are GSC 03413-00005 and 2MASS J07480647+5013328. The star has the following astrometric and photometric properties:
Spectral type : K0V Apparent V Magnitude : 11.18 Distance : 149 (-/+4) pc Mass : 0.98 (-/+0.02) solar masses Radius : 0.964 (-/+0.02) solar radii RA : 07 48 06.468 (FK5, epoch and equinox 2000) Dec : +50 13 32.96 (FK5, epoch and equinox 2000)
The substellar companion XO-2 b was discovered in 2007 by the XO Project (XO). The known properties of this extrasolar planet are:
Mass : 0.57 (-/+0.06) Jupiter masses Semi major axis : 0.0369 (+/-0.002) AU Orbital period : 2.615838 (-/+8e-6) days Eccentricity : 0 Radius : 0.973 (-/+0.03) Jupiter radii Inclination : > 88.58 deg
The astrometric and photometric properties were taken from the 17 March 2009 update for this planetary system in the Extrasolar Planets Encyclopedia. The encyclopedia is maintained by the Paris Observatory and is available online at http://exoplanet.eu. Please consult this web site for the most up-to-date properties.
